  16. ‌#define CAML_INTERNALS

  18. /* Operations on arrays */
  19. #include <string.h>
  20. #include "caml/alloc.h"
  21. #include "caml/fail.h"
  22. #include "caml/memory.h"
  23. #include "caml/misc.h"
  24. #include "caml/mlvalues.h"
  25. #include "caml/signals.h"
  26. #include "caml/runtime_events.h"

  28. ‌static const mlsize_t mlsize_t_max = -1;

  30. /* returns number of elements (either fields or floats) */
  31. /* [ 'a array -> int ] */
  32. ‌CAMLexport mlsize_t caml_array_length(value array)
  33. {
  34. #ifdef FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY
  35.   if (Tag_val(array) == Double_array_tag)
  36.     return Wosize_val(array) / Double_wosize;
  37.   else
  38. #endif
  39.     return Wosize_val(array);
  40. }

  42. ‌CAMLexport int caml_is_double_array(value array)
  43. {
  44.   return (Tag_val(array) == Double_array_tag);
  45. }

  47. /* Note: the OCaml types on the following primitives will work both with
  48.    and without the -no-flat-float-array configure-time option. If you
  49.    respect them, your C code should work in both configurations.
  50. */

  52. /* [ 'a array -> int -> 'a ] where 'a != float */
  53. ‌CAMLprim value caml_array_get_addr(value array, value index)
  54. {
  55.   intnat idx = Long_val(index);
  56.   if (idx < 0 || idx >= Wosize_val(array)) caml_array_bound_error();
  57.   return Field(array, idx);
  58. }

  60. /* [ floatarray -> int -> float ] */
  61. ‌CAMLprim value caml_floatarray_get(value array, value index)
  62. {
  63.   intnat idx = Long_val(index);
  64.   double d;
  65.   value res;

  67.   CAMLassert (Tag_val(array) == Double_array_tag);
  68.   if (idx < 0 || idx >= Wosize_val(array) / Double_wosize)
  69.     caml_array_bound_error();
  70.   d = Double_flat_field(array, idx);
  71.   Alloc_small(res, Double_wosize, Double_tag, Alloc_small_enter_GC);
  72.   Store_double_val(res, d);
  73.   return res;
  74. }

  76. /* [ 'a array -> int -> 'a ] */
  77. ‌CAMLprim value caml_array_get(value array, value index)
  78. {
  79. #ifdef FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY
  80.   if (Tag_val(array) == Double_array_tag)
  81.     return caml_floatarray_get(array, index);
  82. #else
  83.   CAMLassert (Tag_val(array) != Double_array_tag);
  84. #endif
  85.   return caml_array_get_addr(array, index);
  86. }

  88. /* [ 'a array -> int -> 'a -> unit ] where 'a != float */
  89. ‌CAMLprim value caml_array_set_addr(value array, value index, value newval)
  90. {
  91.   intnat idx = Long_val(index);
  92.   if (idx < 0 || idx >= Wosize_val(array)) caml_array_bound_error();
  93.   caml_modify(&Field(array, idx), newval);
  94.   return Val_unit;
  95. }

  97. /* [ floatarray -> int -> float -> unit ] */
  98. ‌CAMLprim value caml_floatarray_set(value array, value index, value newval)
  99. {
  100.   intnat idx = Long_val(index);
  101.   double d = Double_val (newval);
  102.   CAMLassert (Tag_val(array) == Double_array_tag);
  103.   if (idx < 0 || idx >= Wosize_val(array) / Double_wosize)
  104.     caml_array_bound_error();
  105.   Store_double_flat_field(array, idx, d);
  106.   return Val_unit;
  107. }

  109. /* [ 'a array -> int -> 'a -> unit ] */
  110. ‌CAMLprim value caml_array_set(value array, value index, value newval)
  111. {
  112. #ifdef FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY
  113.   if (Tag_val(array) == Double_array_tag)
  114.     return caml_floatarray_set(array, index, newval);
  115. #else
  116.   CAMLassert (Tag_val(array) != Double_array_tag);
  117. #endif
  118.   return caml_array_set_addr(array, index, newval);
  119. }

  121. /* [ floatarray -> int -> float ] */
  122. ‌CAMLprim value caml_floatarray_unsafe_get(value array, value index)
  123. {
  124.   intnat idx = Long_val(index);
  125.   double d;
  126.   value res;

  128.   CAMLassert (Tag_val(array) == Double_array_tag);
  129.   d = Double_flat_field(array, idx);
  130.   Alloc_small(res, Double_wosize, Double_tag, Alloc_small_enter_GC);
  131.   Store_double_val(res, d);
  132.   return res;
  133. }

  135. /* [ 'a array -> int -> 'a ] */
  136. ‌CAMLprim value caml_array_unsafe_get(value array, value index)
  137. {
  138. #ifdef FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY
  139.   if (Tag_val(array) == Double_array_tag)
  140.     return caml_floatarray_unsafe_get(array, index);
  141. #else
  142.   CAMLassert (Tag_val(array) != Double_array_tag);
  143. #endif
  144.   return Field(array, Long_val(index));
  145. }

  147. /* [ 'a array -> int -> 'a -> unit ] where 'a != float */
  148. ‌static value caml_array_unsafe_set_addr(value array, value index,value newval)
  149. {
  150.   intnat idx = Long_val(index);
  151.   caml_modify(&Field(array, idx), newval);
  152.   return Val_unit;
  153. }

  155. /* [ floatarray -> int -> float -> unit ] */
  156. /* [MM]: [caml_array_unsafe_set_addr] has a fence for enforcing the OCaml
  157.    memory model through its use of [caml_modify].
  158.    [MM] [TODO]: [caml_floatarray_unsafe_set] will also need a similar fence in
  159.    [Store_double_flat_field]. */
  160. ‌CAMLprim value caml_floatarray_unsafe_set(value array, value index,value newval)
  161. {
  162.   intnat idx = Long_val(index);
  163.   double d = Double_val (newval);
  164.   Store_double_flat_field(array, idx, d);
  165.   return Val_unit;
  166. }

  168. /* [ 'a array -> int -> 'a -> unit ] */
  169. ‌CAMLprim value caml_array_unsafe_set(value array, value index, value newval)
  170. {
  171. #ifdef FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY
  172.   if (Tag_val(array) == Double_array_tag)
  173.     return caml_floatarray_unsafe_set(array, index, newval);
  174. #else
  175.   CAMLassert (Tag_val(array) != Double_array_tag);
  176. #endif
  177.   return caml_array_unsafe_set_addr(array, index, newval);
  178. }

  180. /* [len] is a [value] representing number of floats. */
  181. /* [ int -> floatarray ] */
  182. ‌CAMLprim value caml_floatarray_create(value len)
  183. {
  184.   mlsize_t wosize = Long_val(len) * Double_wosize;
  185.   value result;
  186.   if (wosize <= Max_young_wosize){
  187.     if (wosize == 0)
  188.       return Atom(0);
  189.     else
  190.       Alloc_small (result, wosize, Double_array_tag, Alloc_small_enter_GC);
  191.   }else if (wosize > Max_wosize)
  192.     caml_invalid_argument("Float.Array.create");
  193.   else {
  194.     result = caml_alloc_shr (wosize, Double_array_tag);
  195.   }
  196.   /* Give the GC a chance to run, and run memprof callbacks */
  197.   return caml_process_pending_actions_with_root(result);
  198. }

  200. /* [len] is a [value] representing number of words or floats */
  201. ‌CAMLprim value caml_make_vect(value len, value init)
  202. {
  203.   CAMLparam2 (len, init);
  204.   CAMLlocal1 (res);
  205.   mlsize_t size, i;

  207.   size = Long_val(len);
  208.   if (size == 0) {
  209.     res = Atom(0);
  210. #ifdef FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY
  211.   } else if (Is_block(init)
  212.              && Tag_val(init) == Double_tag) {
  213.     mlsize_t wsize;
  214.     double d;
  215.     d = Double_val(init);
  216.     wsize = size * Double_wosize;
  217.     if (wsize > Max_wosize) caml_invalid_argument("Array.make");
  218.     res = caml_alloc(wsize, Double_array_tag);
  219.     for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
  220.       Store_double_flat_field(res, i, d);
  221.     }
  222. #endif
  223.   } else {
  224.     if (size <= Max_young_wosize) {
  225.       res = caml_alloc_small(size, 0);
  226.       for (i = 0; i < size; i++) Field(res, i) = init;
  227.     }
  228.     else if (size > Max_wosize) caml_invalid_argument("Array.make");
  229.     else {
  230.       if (Is_block(init) && Is_young(init)) {
  231.         /* We don't want to create so many major-to-minor references,
  232.            so [init] is moved to the major heap by doing a minor GC. */
  233.         CAML_EV_COUNTER (EV_C_FORCE_MINOR_MAKE_VECT, 1);
  234.         caml_minor_collection ();
  235.       }
  236.       CAMLassert(!(Is_block(init) && Is_young(init)));
  237.       res = caml_alloc_shr(size, 0);
  238.       /* We now know that [init] is not in the minor heap, so there is
  239.          no need to call [caml_initialize]. */
  240.       for (i = 0; i < size; i++) Field(res, i) = init;
  241.     }
  242.   }
  243.   /* Give the GC a chance to run, and run memprof callbacks */
  244.   caml_process_pending_actions ();
  245.   CAMLreturn (res);
  246. }

  248. /* [len] is a [value] representing number of floats */
  249. /* [ int -> float array ] */
  250. ‌CAMLprim value caml_make_float_vect(value len)
  251. {
  252. #ifdef FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY
  253.   return caml_floatarray_create (len);
  254. #else
  255.   /* A signaling NaN, statically allocated */
  256.   static uintnat some_float_contents[] = {
  257.     Caml_out_of_heap_header(Double_wosize, Double_tag),
  258. #if defined(ARCH_SIXTYFOUR)
  259.     0x7FF0000000000001
  260. #elif defined(ARCH_BIG_ENDIAN)
  261.     0x7FF00000, 0x00000001,
  262. #else
  263.     0x00000001, 0x7FF00000
  264. #endif
  265.   };
  266.   value some_float = Val_hp(some_float_contents);
  267.   return caml_make_vect (len, some_float);
  268. #endif
  269. }

  271. /* This primitive is used internally by the compiler to compile
  272.    explicit array expressions.
  273.    For float arrays when FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY is true, it takes an array of
  274.    boxed floats and returns the corresponding flat-allocated [float array].
  275.    In all other cases, it just returns its argument unchanged.
  276. */
  277. ‌CAMLprim value caml_make_array(value init)
  278. {
  279. #ifdef FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY
  280.   CAMLparam1 (init);
  281.   mlsize_t wsize, size, i;
  282.   CAMLlocal2 (v, res);

  284.   size = Wosize_val(init);
  285.   if (size == 0) {
  286.     CAMLreturn (init);
  287.   } else {
  288.     v = Field(init, 0);
  289.     if (Is_long(v)
  290.         || Tag_val(v) != Double_tag) {
  291.       CAMLreturn (init);
  292.     } else {
  293.       wsize = size * Double_wosize;
  294.       if (wsize <= Max_young_wosize) {
  295.         res = caml_alloc_small(wsize, Double_array_tag);
  296.       } else {
  297.         res = caml_alloc_shr(wsize, Double_array_tag);
  298.       }
  299.       for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
  300.         double d = Double_val(Field(init, i));
  301.         Store_double_flat_field(res, i, d);
  302.       }
  303.       /* run memprof callbacks */
  304.       caml_process_pending_actions();
  305.       CAMLreturn (res);
  306.     }
  307.   }
  308. #else
  309.   return init;
  310. #endif
  311. }

  313. /* Blitting */

  315. /* [wo_memmove] copies [nvals] values from [src] to [dst]. If there is a single
  316.    domain running, then we use [memmove]. Otherwise, we copy one word at a
  317.    time.

  319.    Since the [memmove] implementation does not guarantee that the writes are
  320.    always word-sized, we explicitly perform word-sized writes of the release
  321.    kind to avoid mixed-mode accesses. Performing release writes should be
  322.    sufficient to prevent smart compilers from coalesing the writes into vector
  323.    writes, and hence prevent mixed-mode accesses. [MM].
  324.    */
  325. ‌static void wo_memmove (volatile value* const dst,
  326.                         volatile const value* const src,
  327.                         mlsize_t nvals)
  328. {
  329.   mlsize_t i;

  331.   if (caml_domain_alone ()) {
  332.     memmove ((value*)dst, (value*)src, nvals * sizeof (value));
  333.   } else {
  334.     /* See memory model [MM] notes in memory.c */
  335.     atomic_thread_fence(memory_order_acquire);
  336.     if (dst < src) {
  337.       /* copy ascending */
  338.       for (i = 0; i < nvals; i++)
  339.         atomic_store_release(&((atomic_value*)dst)[i], src[i]);

  341.     } else {
  342.       /* copy descending */
  343.       for (i = nvals; i > 0; i--)
  344.         atomic_store_release(&((atomic_value*)dst)[i-1], src[i-1]);
  345.     }
  346.   }
  347. }

  349. /* [MM] [TODO]: Not consistent with the memory model. See the discussion in
  350.    https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-multicore/pull/822. */
  351. ‌CAMLprim value caml_floatarray_blit(value a1, value ofs1, value a2, value ofs2,
  352.                                     value n)
  353. {
  354.   /* See memory model [MM] notes in memory.c */
  355.   atomic_thread_fence(memory_order_acquire);
  356.   memmove((double *)a2 + Long_val(ofs2),
  357.           (double *)a1 + Long_val(ofs1),
  358.           Long_val(n) * sizeof(double));
  359.   return Val_unit;
  360. }

  362. ‌CAMLprim value caml_array_blit(value a1, value ofs1, value a2, value ofs2,
  363.                                value n)
  364. {
  365.   volatile value * src, * dst;
  366.   intnat count;

  368. #ifdef FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY
  369.   if (Tag_val(a2) == Double_array_tag)
  370.     return caml_floatarray_blit(a1, ofs1, a2, ofs2, n);
  371. #endif
  372.   CAMLassert (Tag_val(a2) != Double_array_tag);
  373.   if (Is_young(a2)) {
  374.     /* Arrays of values, destination is in young generation.
  375.        Here too we can do a direct copy since this cannot create
  376.        old-to-young pointers, nor mess up with the incremental major GC.
  377.        Again, wo_memmove takes care of overlap. */
  378.     wo_memmove(&Field(a2, Long_val(ofs2)),
  379.                &Field(a1, Long_val(ofs1)),
  380.                Long_val(n));
  381.     return Val_unit;
  382.   }
  383.   /* Array of values, destination is in old generation.
  384.      We must use caml_modify.  */
  385.   count = Long_val(n);
  386.   if (a1 == a2 && Long_val(ofs1) < Long_val(ofs2)) {
  387.     /* Copy in descending order */
  388.     for (dst = &Field(a2, Long_val(ofs2) + count - 1),
  389.            src = &Field(a1, Long_val(ofs1) + count - 1);
  390.          count > 0;
  391.          count--, src--, dst--) {
  392.       caml_modify(dst, *src);
  393.     }
  394.   } else {
  395.     /* Copy in ascending order */
  396.     for (dst = &Field(a2, Long_val(ofs2)), src = &Field(a1, Long_val(ofs1));
  397.          count > 0;
  398.          count--, src++, dst++) {
  399.       caml_modify(dst, *src);
  400.     }
  401.   }
  402.   /* Many caml_modify in a row can create a lot of old-to-young refs.
  403.      Give the minor GC a chance to run if it needs to. */
  404.   caml_check_urgent_gc(Val_unit);
  405.   return Val_unit;
  406. }

  408. /* A generic function for extraction and concatenation of sub-arrays */

  410. ‌static value caml_array_gather(intnat num_arrays,
  411.                                value arrays[/*num_arrays*/],
  412.                                intnat offsets[/*num_arrays*/],
  413.                                intnat lengths[/*num_arrays*/])
  414. {
  415.   CAMLparamN(arrays, num_arrays);
  416.   value res;                    /* no need to register it as a root */
  417. #ifdef FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY
  418.   int isfloat = 0;
  419.   mlsize_t wsize;
  420. #endif
  421.   mlsize_t i, size, count, pos;
  422.   volatile value * src;

  424.   /* Determine total size and whether result array is an array of floats */
  425.   size = 0;
  426.   for (i = 0; i < num_arrays; i++) {
  427.     if (mlsize_t_max - lengths[i] < size) caml_invalid_argument("Array.concat");
  428.     size += lengths[i];
  429. #ifdef FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY
  430.     if (Tag_val(arrays[i]) == Double_array_tag) isfloat = 1;
  431. #endif
  432.   }
  433.   if (size == 0) {
  434.     /* If total size = 0, just return empty array */
  435.     res = Atom(0);
  436.   }
  437. #ifdef FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY
  438.   else if (isfloat) {
  439.     /* This is an array of floats.  We can use memcpy directly. */
  440.     if (size > Max_wosize/Double_wosize) caml_invalid_argument("Array.concat");
  441.     wsize = size * Double_wosize;
  442.     res = caml_alloc(wsize, Double_array_tag);
  443.     for (i = 0, pos = 0; i < num_arrays; i++) {
  444.       /* [res] is freshly allocated, and no other domain has a reference to it.
  445.          Hence, a plain [memcpy] is sufficient. */
  446.       memcpy((double *)res + pos,
  447.              (double *)arrays[i] + offsets[i],
  448.              lengths[i] * sizeof(double));
  449.       pos += lengths[i];
  450.     }
  451.     CAMLassert(pos == size);
  452.   }
  453. #endif
  454.   else if (size <= Max_young_wosize) {
  455.     /* Array of values, small enough to fit in young generation.
  456.        We can use memcpy directly. */
  457.     res = caml_alloc_small(size, 0);
  458.     for (i = 0, pos = 0; i < num_arrays; i++) {
  459.       /* [res] is freshly allocated, and no other domain has a reference to it.
  460.          Hence, a plain [memcpy] is sufficient. */
  461.       memcpy((value*)&Field(res, pos),
  462.              (value*)&Field(arrays[i], offsets[i]),
  463.              lengths[i] * sizeof(value));
  464.       pos += lengths[i];
  465.     }
  466.     CAMLassert(pos == size);
  467.   }
  468.   else if (size > Max_wosize) {
  469.     /* Array of values, too big. */
  470.     caml_invalid_argument("Array.concat");
  471.   } else {
  472.     /* Array of values, must be allocated in old generation and filled
  473.        using caml_initialize. */
  474.     res = caml_alloc_shr(size, 0);
  475.     for (i = 0, pos = 0; i < num_arrays; i++) {
  476.       for (src = &Field(arrays[i], offsets[i]), count = lengths[i];
  477.            count > 0;
  478.            count--, src++, pos++) {
  479.         caml_initialize(&Field(res, pos), *src);
  480.       }
  481.     }
  482.     CAMLassert(pos == size);

  484.     /* Many caml_initialize in a row can create a lot of old-to-young
  485.        refs.  Give the minor GC a chance to run if it needs to.
  486.        Run memprof callbacks for the major allocation. */
  487.     res = caml_process_pending_actions_with_root (res);
  488.   }
  489.   CAMLreturn (res);
  490. }

  492. ‌CAMLprim value caml_array_sub(value a, value ofs, value len)
  493. {
  494.   value arrays[1] = { a };
  495.   intnat offsets[1] = { Long_val(ofs) };
  496.   intnat lengths[1] = { Long_val(len) };
  497.   return caml_array_gather(1, arrays, offsets, lengths);
  498. }

  500. ‌CAMLprim value caml_array_append(value a1, value a2)
  501. {
  502.   value arrays[2] = { a1, a2 };
  503.   intnat offsets[2] = { 0, 0 };
  504.   intnat lengths[2] = { caml_array_length(a1), caml_array_length(a2) };
  505.   return caml_array_gather(2, arrays, offsets, lengths);
  506. }

  508. ‌CAMLprim value caml_array_concat(value al)
  509. {
  510. ‌#define STATIC_SIZE 16
  511.   value static_arrays[STATIC_SIZE], * arrays;
  512.   intnat static_offsets[STATIC_SIZE], * offsets;
  513.   intnat static_lengths[STATIC_SIZE], * lengths;
  514.   intnat n, i;
  515.   value l, res;

  517.   /* Length of list = number of arrays */
  518.   for (n = 0, l = al; l != Val_emptylist; l = Field(l, 1)) n++;
  519.   /* Allocate extra storage if too many arrays */
  520.   if (n <= STATIC_SIZE) {
  521.     arrays = static_arrays;
  522.     offsets = static_offsets;
  523.     lengths = static_lengths;
  524.   } else {
  525.     arrays = caml_stat_alloc(n * sizeof(value));
  526.     offsets = caml_stat_alloc_noexc(n * sizeof(intnat));
  527.     if (offsets == NULL) {
  528.       caml_stat_free(arrays);
  529.       caml_raise_out_of_memory();
  530.     }
  531.     lengths = caml_stat_alloc_noexc(n * sizeof(value));
  532.     if (lengths == NULL) {
  533.       caml_stat_free(offsets);
  534.       caml_stat_free(arrays);
  535.       caml_raise_out_of_memory();
  536.     }
  537.   }
  538.   /* Build the parameters to caml_array_gather */
  539.   for (i = 0, l = al; l != Val_emptylist; l = Field(l, 1), i++) {
  540.     arrays[i] = Field(l, 0);
  541.     offsets[i] = 0;
  542.     lengths[i] = caml_array_length(Field(l, 0));
  543.   }
  544.   /* Do the concatenation */
  545.   res = caml_array_gather(n, arrays, offsets, lengths);
  546.   /* Free the extra storage if needed */
  547.   if (n > STATIC_SIZE) {
  548.     caml_stat_free(arrays);
  549.     caml_stat_free(offsets);
  550.     caml_stat_free(lengths);
  551.   }
  552.   return res;
  553. }

  555. ‌CAMLprim value caml_array_fill(value array,
  556.                                value v_ofs,
  557.                                value v_len,
  558.                                value val)
  559. {
  560.   intnat ofs = Long_val(v_ofs);
  561.   intnat len = Long_val(v_len);
  562.   volatile value* fp;

  564.   /* This duplicates the logic of caml_modify.  Please refer to the
  565.      implementation of that function for a description of GC
  566.      invariants we need to enforce.*/

  568. #ifdef FLAT_FLOAT_ARRAY
  569.   if (Tag_val(array) == Double_array_tag) {
  570.     double d = Double_val (val);
  571.     for (; len > 0; len--, ofs++)
  572.       Store_double_flat_field(array, ofs, d);
  573.     return Val_unit;
  574.   }
  575. #endif
  576.   fp = &Field(array, ofs);
  577.   if (Is_young(array)) {
  578.     for (; len > 0; len--, fp++) *fp = val;
  579.   } else {
  580.     int is_val_young_block = Is_block(val) && Is_young(val);
  581.     for (; len > 0; len--, fp++) {
  582.       value old = *fp;
  583.       if (old == val) continue;
  584.       *fp = val;
  585.       if (Is_block(old)) {
  586.         if (Is_young(old)) continue;
  587.         caml_darken(Caml_state, old, NULL);
  588.       }
  589.       if (is_val_young_block)
  590.         Ref_table_add(&Caml_state->minor_tables->major_ref, fp);
  591.     }
  592.     if (is_val_young_block) caml_check_urgent_gc (Val_unit);
  593.   }
  594.   return Val_unit;
  595. }

One Level Up Top Level
